svcsubproc.title: Springs

step1.para: Position the new or rebuilt spring assembly on the saddle with the spring center bolt head positioned in the saddle.
U/UE Springs: Position the top pad on the main spring leaf. Install the U-bolts, washers and locknuts ( Figure 35). Tighten the nuts to the value found in the TORQUE CHART.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3.LOCKNUTS (TIGHTEN TO CORRECT VALUES AFTER RAPPING U- BOLTS)

step1.para: Rap the top of the U-bolts with a hammer to settle out the assembly, then re-tighten the U-bolt locknuts to the value found in the TORQUE CHART.

caution.para: Failure to rap the U-bolts and re-tighten the locknuts may cause the parts to loosen in service, which will damage the pilot hole.

step1.para: RT/RTE, RT2/RTE2 Springs: Assemble the four top pad bolts with washers and locknuts through the top pad and saddle. Snug up the locknuts enough to hold the assembly in place.

svcsubproc.para: Assemble the top pad set screws with lockwashers and nuts. Evenly tighten the set screws. Tighten the set screw nuts until the lockwashers are flattened. Evenly tighten the top pad bolt locknuts in the sequence shown in Figure 36.

figure.caption: Figure 36. Tightening Sequence - Top Pad Bolt Locknuts

step1.para: Coat the I.D. of the spring eye bushing with lubricant. Position the spring-and-saddle assembly into the spring brackets.
Align the leaf spring eye and the spring pin bore in the rear spring front bracket. Coat the spring bracket pin with lubricant.
With the slotted end facing outward, pilot the pin into the outside bracket leg, through the spring eye, and into the spring bracket inboard leg. Refer to Figure 37.

figure.caption: Figure 37. Align Leaf Spring Eye and Spring Pin Bore

step1.para: For drawkey spring brackets: Rotate the spring bracket pin to align its keyway with the slot, then insert the drawkey with the flat side up. Fit the flat of the drawkey into the pin keyway. Drive the drawkey with a hammer. Assemble the lockwasher and retaining nut, then tighten to the value found in the TORQUE CHART.

important.para: If the drawkey enters the pin keyway at an angle, it will wedge and gall. When locked in this position, it will become loose in a short time and allow the pin to turn and elongate the spring bracket pin hole. This may result in the failure of the pin, spring eye or spring bracket.

step1.para: For double lock spring brackets: Rotate the spring bracket pin to align its keyways with the slot, then insert the bolts and assemble with flat washers and retaining nuts on both legs. Tighten the nuts to the value found in the TORQUE CHART.
Install the lube fitting. Pressure lubricate until lubricant appears at both ends of the spring eye bushing.
Assemble the rebound bolt with the spacer and locknut through the legs of the rear spring rear bracket ( Figure 38).

figure.caption: Figure 38. Legs of the Rear Spring Bracket
